nodes.bodyText:
Does it make sense to reuse our normal okhttp decorator?
https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java-instrumentation/blob/master/instrumentation/okhttp/okhttp-3.0/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/auto/instrumentation/okhttp/v3_0/OkHttpClientDecorator.java#L26
It's currently not that much code but could grow into more and more duplication

yeah i actually started by trying to import the okhttp3 instrument code, but in the end it turns out that there're only 20-ish lines of duplication.. additionally am not sure if cross-referencing between instrumenting libraries are legal in the project?
Make everything except the instrumentation and interceptor package private

nodes.bodyText: commons lang is leaked in but is not one of our standard libraries, either use guava or just inline the checks since it's not much code here

nodes.bodyText: done
Use concatenation of StringBuilder instead of String.format
replaced w/ StringBuilder
Pass these into constructor and make final as well
done
We usually don't have these tags here. Please remove.
oh oversight, should have swipe all these generated comments
Please add class loader matcher as well. There are plenty of examples in other instrumenters.
i wrapped the name matcher w/ extendsClass(..), is that what you're expecting?
Can you modify incoming parameter interceptors and add a new one there? I don't know this API, so don't have any hard preferences :)

the interceptors are immutable so i have to craft a new list instead of updating in-place..
https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/blob/d5b80572498122bb45c830c74f89b871dbbdfc92/kubernetes/src/main/java/io/kubernetes/client/openapi/ApiClient.java#L93
You can change this method to Advice.OnMethodEnter, change interceptors argument to readOnly = false and construct new list which includes both old value of interceptors and TracingInterceptor
Does Kubernetes client depend on okhttp? This compileOnly here essentially assumes that whenever this instrumentation is applied, there will be okhttp present in that JVM as well. Is it true?
removed okhttp dependencies, the kubernetes dependency already contains it
Make final and pass in through constructor
done
